    Plot interval dates

    plot.dates.Rd

    A function to plot interval dates.

    plot.dates(x, y, type = c("ts", "mp", "rg"), taq, tpq, id, out, 
    col, cex, lwd, lty, pch, main = NULL, xlab = NULL, ylab = NULL, 
    xlim = NULL, axes = TRUE, alpha, file = NULL, ...)

    Arguments

    x

    dataset as a data frame object of variables and observations.

    y

    optional identifiers (vector).

    type

    Type of date format to plot:

    ts timespans

    mp mid points and range

    rg only range

    taq

    terminus ante quem

    tpq

    terminus post quem

    id

    IDs as variable or rownames in dataset x

    out

    number of outliers to omit (integer or vector where first entry id for latest date)

    col

    color of pch

    cex

    size of pch

    lwd

    width of time interval segments

    lty

    shape of time interval segments

    pch

    symbol for taq and tpq

    main

    plot's main tile

    xlab

    plot's x label

    ylab

    plot's y label

    xlim

    plot's x limits

    axes

    plot's axes (logical)

    alpha

    alpha transparency for time interval segments

    file

    path to file for a PDF format (optional)

    ...

    additional optional parameters

    Details

    This plot function is for time interval segments given in the dataset x, which is given as a data frame or as a ``tibble'' class object.

    Value

    A graphical plot.

    Author

    Antonio Rivero Ostoic

    Note

    If x is NULL, then EDH dataset is taken.

    See also

    get.edh, edhw, prex.

    Examples

    #TBD.
